channel.title: Is it possible?
channel.description: Is there anyway that i can host my server without portforwarding, because i dont know my router details as i live in a large appartment where internet is supplied to everyone and all i do is plug into a port in the wall?

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

xeqt:

Is there anyway that i can host my server without portforwarding, because i dont know my router details as i live in a large appartment where internet is supplied to everyone and all i do is plug into a port in the wall?

If you have a stupid manager ask him the router details say you need the password and user name to get internet at your house or something like that.

Also, iv seen alot of this lately…

2) We will not help with computer problems, ie: portforwarding, how to set up java and such. Use google or our Tutorial Section.

Read full topic

item.title: Is it possible?
item.dc:creator: @Zev Zev
item.description:
@Zev wrote:

In fact, there is.

go into the start menu and open up the control panel.
look for firewall settings and click on the “exceptions” tab.

at the bottom of the box you will see “add port” click on it. Name it whatever you want and use port 43594.

Read full topic
